mimic-fn

Make a function mimic another one

Useful when you wrap a function in another function and like to preserve the original name and other properties.

Install

$ npm install --save mimic-fn

Usage

```js const mimicFn = require(â€˜mimic-fnâ€™);

function foo() {} foo.unicorn = â€˜ðŸ¦„â€™;

function wrapper() { return foo() {}; }

console.log(wrapper.name); //=> â€˜wrapperâ€™

mimicFn(wrapper, foo);

console.log(wrapper.name); //=> â€˜fooâ€™

console.log(wrapper.unicorn); //=> â€˜ðŸ¦„â€™ ```

API

It will copy over the properties name, length, displayName, and any custom properties you may have set.

mimicFn(to, from)

to

Type: Function

Mimicking function.

from

Type: Function

Function to mimic.

Related

  • rename-fn - Rename a function
